availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Andrew L. Edwards (Edmonson County, Kentucky, farmer and soldier)

body.p: Edmonson County, Kentucky, farmer and soldier. Kentucky native. Son of Levi Edwards and Malinda Edwards. Married to Margaret J. Edwards. Laborer in Edmonson County in 1860. Served in the 52nd Kentucky Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.) as a private from March 3, 1864, to March 12, 1865.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Edmonson County, Brownsville, p. 23.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Edmonson County, Brownsville, p. 408B.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 0452.
Find A Grave, "Andrew Lewis Edwards (1841-1932)," Memorial #102788286, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/102788286 (accessed June 7, 2020).
